subject: Re: [junit] Need to test a method that returns void
msgSnippet: ... Search with Google. The answers are out there. This is a very frequently asked question. -- J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.info Your guide
messageBody:
kotuv wrote:
> Need to test a method that returns 'void'. Failure of the method is by
> thorowing an exception. If no exception is thrown it is success.
>
> I have wrapped the method call in try...catch and placed
> Assert.assertTrue(false) statement in the catch block. However even
> when exception is thrown, this statement is not executed
> and 'Succeful' message is output.

Search with Google. The answers are out there. This is a very frequently
asked question.
--
J. B. (Joe) Rainsberger :: http://www.jbrains.info
Your guide to software craftsmanship
JUnit Recipes: Practical Methods for Programmer Testing
2005 Gordon Pask Award for contribution Agile Software Practice
